bill_title: prohibit certain forms of compensation for persons circulating petitions.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit certain forms of compensation for persons circulating petitions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No person may receive any wages, reward, or compensation for circulating any petition for any initiated measure or referendum based on the number of signatures obtained by the circulator on the petition. Nothing in this section prohibits any person from being employed on an hourly or salaried basis to circulate such petitions. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. No person may employ, reward, or compensate any person to circulate any petition for any initiated measure or referendum based on the number of signatures obtained by the circulator on the petition. Nothing in this section prohibits any person from hiring a person paid on an hourly or salaried basis to circulate such petitions. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
